page.title: 01Dalmellington & Bogton Loch
page.content: The river Doon roadens as it flows through Bogton Loch with its surrounding marshes which form an ideal nesting ground for wild duck and other marsh birds. The loch is overlooked to the North and East by the slag bings and houses of Dlellington, a one time mining village with its post war suburb of Bellsbank standing bleakly above the trees along the river. To the South and West of the loch the ground rises steeply in the grassy hills of the Southern Uplands with scattered woods to spruce and larch provideding shelter for the Blackface Sheep and Galloway cattle of the neightbouring hill farms.
